column3: str
Though the relay bears no visible signs of damage, it does not appear to be functioning at the moment...
(-Krile-)This is Krile. Call it an educated guess, but I thought you might have arrived at Aethernet Control by now. If so, how does it look?
(-Krile-)...Well, at least it wasn't smashed to pieces. If your assessment is correct, we may be able to reintegrate it into the Aethernet.

(-Krile-)This may not sound like the most elegant solution, but sixty percent of the time it works every time. Right─we're going to flood the relay with a massive amount of aether to “wake” it up, as it were.
(-Krile-)To that end, we're going to need to amass a substantial quantity of Anemos crystals. Ninety-nine crystals, assuming my calculations are correct.
(-Krile-)I know it's a lot to ask, but I believe this is our best bet. Once you have them, bring them to Aethernet Control and I'll walk you through the process.
To flood the Aethernet relay and continue the Eureka expedition, you will need to procure ninety-nine Anemos crystals. Please note that these crystals will be consumed in the process.
Use the ninety-nine Anemos crystals to flood the relay with aether?
(-Krile-)This is it, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Are you ready?
(-Krile-)Rechecking measurements... Right. Listen carefully. To flood the relay with aether, we will need to repurpose your magia board as an elemental converter...

Seekest thou...power? Power to smite thine enemies?
To cast down the wicked and raise up the righteous?
What will you say?
All that and more...

A warrior, then! Coveter of strength!
Blessed art thou, arbiter of vengeance!

Art thou a pawn, then!? Content to surrender to the whim of fate─
to bid welcome to the wicked and the dark!?
And within...within... A light burning, radiant, resplendent!
Lo, in light <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> walketh...and in light <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> abideth. Thus will I remember thee.
...There is no other way.
Aye. Even if we fought the damned thing to our dying breaths, it'd endure. It's as though it has a nigh-bottomless wellspring of aether to draw upon...
Until such time as a permanent solution is found, it shall be sealed away. If any among you yet harbor doubts, speak them now.
You'll hear none from me. Let's do it and be done with it.
Right, then. The matter of what to do may have been resolved, but we've still the matter of where to do it.
Not in the colony. That much is plain. The location must be remote─far from prying eyes and covetous men.
Well, Galuf? This was your idea. Got any suggestions?
(-Galuf-)As a matter of fact, I do. An island not far from the motherland. Deserted. Dangerous. The perfect place to build a prison...
(-Krile-)...<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? What happened? Please respond.
(-Krile-)Worked, did it? Glad to hear it. Our readings suggested as much, but I wanted your confirmation before I performed the final test...

Well! I appear to have arrived with all my bits intact. I believe that constitutes a success. Very good. I'll have to perform various adjustments and measurements before we can risk teleportation to other regions, but this is nevertheless a significant accomplishment.
By the way, you took an awfully long time to respond after initiating the process. Did something happen?
Galuf!? You're certain that's the name you heard spoken in the vision?
Four men, one of them a Lupin. And this masked man you met. If they were Grandfather's... Then would that make him...
Ah, forgive me. Neither the time nor the place. Let us return to Port Surgate.
Though the Aethernet relay appears to be fully operational at a glance, you recall Krile saying that it would require further adjustments before travel to other regions would be possible...
The Aethernet relay appears to be functioning somewhat more efficiently than before, likely due to Krile's adjustments. Travel to other regions should no longer pose significant risk.
To continue the expedition elsewhere, you must depart <Sheet(ContentFinderCondition,IntegerParameter(1),38)/> and speak with Rodney at Pier #1 in Kugane.
